Topic.Title: Apple iPhone 5 delay, chip worries surface (again)

Message.Msg: As a mature dependable supplier, Intel is waiting in the wings. Tim Cook needs to pull the trigger soon or risk going downhill fast! ----- The 28nm part in question is the baseband. Intel's baseband is based on a 40nm process and manufactured by TSMC. For the application processor, Apple will use Samsung's 32nm process.

Topic.Title: Apple iPhone 5 delay, chip worries surface (again)

Message.Msg: What an awkward relationship for Apple. Samsung just blew past Apple in smartphone sales and now Apple is dependent on parts from the same company to get its own product out the door. Any goodwill that existed between the two probably disappared long ago and Apple is likely throwing their delivery contract in Samsung's face daily. Is this the reality Cook wants to live with?

Topic.Title: INTC July 2001 Shares Prices

Message.Msg: acually the split was in july 2000 and the multiple was over 29 forward at the time. INTC is selling for less now than in 2007 when the forward earnings were projected to be 1.88 P/S. The market is assigning a lower multiple but it is actually worth more.

Topic.Title: INTC July 2001 Shares Prices

Message.Msg: I would hope that people reading the link would understand the definition of ADJUSTED CLOSE. The adjusted close of $24.19 is the price of Intel stock adjusted for the dividend paid over the last 10 years. $29.81 was the close and the adjusted close $24.19 compute $5.62 in dividends in the past 10 years. The "lame dividend" argument is not too lame if Intel was bought in the last couple years at prices below $20 or even if its sole purpose is for income. People follow stocks and participate in the discussions for personal profit. The only other reason that I can think of is for entertainment. Are there any other reasons? It really does not matter what the Intel price was 10 years ago does it? It matters what the Intel price is tomorrow, next month, next year, ... and what the prospects are for tomorrow. It is hard to make any money on the past. I buy the stock and keep a core position. Sell puts after a sell off and sell covered calls (buy-writes) after a run up. It seems to be a steady predictable source of income. The share price seems to be reacting (not controlled) to option activity (strangles and straddles) that seemed to be timed to the dividend payments.

Message.Msg: Today it's only worth $60k but I don't care because I'm only concerned with tomorrow, next month, next year, ... and what the prospects are for tomorrow. And I've realized the dividend of having lived in a nice home for the last 10 years! TOOOOOOOOOOOO FUNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNY!

Topic.Title: INTC July 2001 Shares Prices

Message.Msg: I did not say "History is irrelevant". Those are your words. I asked how important the price 10 years ago was. Is it important to me? I purchased shares around $20 for several accounts last year. Is the price 10 years ago important to me and how should I use it for determining the price next month? I don't know why it has much importance to me. I am long Intel shares for the long term. I have a core position and trade additional shares around that core position. I write put options after a sell off. I write covered calls after a run up. I think that Intel, when priced at $20, with its prospects was a good buy for me and my objectives. I am up about 20% + those unimportant dividends. I will probably not buy any more Intel above $25 unless something changes. I will trade the options around the dividend cycle. They seem predictable and have been kind to me. "Closet pumper"? as you always say "too funny"

Topic.Title: I Bought A New House 10 Years Ago for $100K

Message.Msg: Your prospect for "tomorrow" in your real estate investment is for a slow, steady recovery. Just my opinion. It will take some time before you would recover your original investment if you decide to hold it. If I had your unfortunate timing, I would be upset too. I know of people who did make the mistake you made. It is unpleasant and explains some of your anger. However, for me, I converted cash into homes for my kids and bought their homes at $50k. Now at $60k they are up 20% + the dividend of having their own home, including the mortgage and real estate tax deductions. When homes were selling at $100k, I told them that homes were too expensive and they should not buy. I enforced my position by not agreeing to help them. I can't offer you guidance on your home, you will have to look at your objectives and make that decision yourself. I don't know all the facts that influence your decisions. As for my kids, I think they will continue to hold and enjoy the dividends of home ownership. A good long term investment is nice to have. Don't you think?

Topic.Title: Chickenhawk Willard ready to strike Iran...

Message.Msg: This will not get him all the Republicans. It will get him all those Republicans who do not remember Iran and Afghanistan and their ongoing costs. It wins him the Whacky Wright. It should scare the independents who recognize the Rove Rhetoric talking points out of the Romney camp. All that will be left will be the birthers, pro-life extremists, ultra-wealthy, and the code-word Obama haters. Anyone that thinks that Romney "talking tough" in the middlle east draws anything but laughter in Iran, .... does not understand their thought process and culture. Romney has no history of talking tough. He has a history of saying whatever will get the vote today. They can read what he says and understand why he is saying it. It is so easy to parrot the rhetoric ... on both sides.

Topic.Title: INTC July 2001 Shares Prices

Message.Msg: This ten year comparison is what the lucies pull out again and again when they don't have anything in the last nine years with which to bash the stock. It's best not to respond to such stupidity. Nothing has changed with Intel's potential except that it is a much better value with 4 bucks having been mindlessly taken off the stock price. Every day we get closer to 14nm production and the end of days for Intel's competition. Ever since Intel announced FinFET it's been all about the fabrication. End of story...
